thread.title: First half mistakes doom Colts in loss to Saints
thread.title_full: First half mistakes doom Colts in loss to Saints

title: First half mistakes doom Colts in loss to Saints
text:
First half mistakes doom Colts in loss to Saints 
By Dean Pantazi - 21 Alive Indianapolis Colts October 25, 2015 Updated Oct 25, 2015 at 9:00 PM EDT 
INDIANAPOLIS, Ind. (21 Alive) - The New Orleans Saints built a 27-0 lead on the Colts Sunday and then withstood an Indianapolis comeback for a 27-21 win.. 
Khiry Robinson ran for two scores and Mark Ingram added another rushing touchdown while gaining 143 yards on the ground. 
Digital Daily â€“ subscribe to our daily newsletter 
Two of the three first half New Orleans touchdowns came after Indianapolis turnovers, one of two interceptions thrown by Andrew Lick and a fumble on a kickoff return by Griff Whalen. 
Luck threw three touchdown passes in the second half, two of them long ones to T.Y. Hilton, but the Colts' comeback ran out of time.
